title: Riemann sphere
summary: In mathematics, the Riemann sphere, named after Bernhard Riemann,[1] is a model of the extended complex plane: the complex plane plus one point at infinity. This extended plane represents the extended complex numbers, that is, the complex numbers plus a value ∞ {\displaystyle \infty } for infinity. With the Riemann model, the point ∞ {\displaystyle \infty } is near to very large numbers, just as the point 0 {\displaystyle 0} is near to very small numbers.
